page.title: 18The Menzies Hall: FINTRY
page.content: Built in the centre of the village by{ {Sir Walter Menzies}in 1907, it is now beside an area of grass and trees. Many improvements have been carried out, internally by the Hall Committee, the District Council being responsible for the exterior. {The main hall}is used by the Drama Society, Women's Rural, aerobics class and badminton, large meetings, coffee mornings, concerts, parties and dances. Annual events held include, the pantomine, flower show, crafts fair and the Art Club hanging party. {The adjacent lesser hall}accommodates bowling and is useful for small meetings and for serving refreshments (linked to kitchen and toilets). {Two small rooms}house a weekly bank and twice weekly surgery. There are public toilets attached.
